section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter governs all persons licensed as audiologists, audiology assistants, hearing aid dispensers, speech-language pathologists, speech-language pathology assistants, or music therapists in the State.

para.text: Application fee for full audiology, speech-language pathology license ... $150
Hearing aid dispenser examination fee ... $150
Repeat hearing aid dispenser written examination ... $100
Waiver of hearing aid dispenser written examination ... $100
Biennial renewal of license fee ... $250
Biennial renewal of dual audiology/speech-language pathology license fee ... $400
Late fee for renewal of license ... $100
Application fee for Audiology and Speech-Language Pathology Interstate Compact (ASLP-IC) privileges … $100
Reinstatement of expired license:
Fee to reinstate an expired license where the licensee did not actively practice in another state ... $200;
Fee to reinstate an expired license where the licensee was actively licensed and practicing in another state ... $50
Application fee for limited audiology or speech-language pathology license ... $100
Application fee for hearing aid dispenser limited license and examination ... $150
Renewal of limited license fee ... $25
Physical copy of registration certificate ... $5
Physical copy of wall certificate ... $25
Application fee for full speech-language pathology assistant or audiology assistant license ... $100
Application fee for limited speech-language pathology assistant license ... $100
Biennial renewal of full speech-language pathology assistant or audiology assistant license fee ... $100
Renewal of limited speech-language pathology assistant license fee ... $25
Verification of license fee ... $25
Returned check fee ... $25
Speech-language pathologists roster fee ... $75
Audiologists roster fee ... $55
Hearing aid dispensers roster fee ... $55
Music therapists roster fee … $55
Inactive status fee ... $25
Reactivation fee ... $50 in addition to renewal fee and Maryland Health Care Commission fee
Fees are subject to change by action of the Board. All licensees and applicants will be notified of changes.
Application forms should be requested from the Board of Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists.

section.heading: Fee Exceptions.
section.text: An audiologist, hearing aid dispenser, speech-language pathologist, or music therapist who holds a current license is exempt from paying the license verification fee.

section.heading: Refunds, Proration, Prohibition.
section.text: Fees paid to the Board are nonrefundable and may not be prorated.

annotations.annotation: Health Occupations Article, §§2-205 and 2-206, Annotated Code of Maryland

Regulation .03 amended effective July 14, 1978 (5:14 Md. R. 1137); August 5, 2024 (51:15 Md. R. 708)
Regulation .03B amended effective November 7, 1983 (10:22 Md. R. 1966)
Regulation .04 adopted effective February 3, 2003 (30:2 Md. R. 76)
Regulation .04 recodified to be Regulation .05 and new Regulation .04 adopted effective January 28, 2008 (35:2 Md. R. 127)
Regulation .04 amended effective August 5, 2024 (51:15 Md. R. 708)
